column1: Borovsky District (Russian: Боровский райо́н) is an administrative and municipal district (raion)
column2: one of the twenty-four in Kaluga Oblast
column3: Russia. It is located in the north of the oblast. The area of the district is 759.6 square kilometers (293.3 sq mi). Its administrative center is the town of Borovsk.  Population: 61
column6: 698 (1989 Census). The population of Borovsk accounts for 20.0% of the district's total population.
